{{also|Wissen}} ==Dutch== ===Pronunciation=== * {{audio|nl|Nl-wissen.ogg|Audio}} * {{rhymes|nl|ɪsən}} ===Etymology 1=== From {{inh|nl|dum|wisschen}}, from {{inh|nl|odt|*wisken}}, from {{inh|nl|gem-pro|*wiskijaną}}. ====Verb==== {{nl-verb}} # to [[erase]] =====Inflection===== {{nl-conj-wk|wis|wisse}} =====Derived terms===== * {{l|nl|uitwissen}} * {{l|nl|wisser}} ===Etymology 2=== {{nonlemma}} ====Noun==== {{head|nl|noun plural form}} # {{nl-noun form of|pl|wis}} ---- ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{etyl|goh|de}} {{m|goh|wizzan}}, from {{etyl|gem-pro|de}} {{m|gem-pro|*witaną}}, from {{etyl|ine-pro|de}} {{m|ine-pro|*weyd-||see, know}}. Compare {{cog|nl|weten}}, {{cog|da|vide}}, {{cog|sv|veta}}, archaic Modern English verb {{m|en|wit}} and Latin {{m|la|videō}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{audio|de|DE-wissen.ogg|audio}} * {{audio|de|BY-wissen.ogg|Audio (Bavarian)}} * {{IPA|de|/ˈvɪsn̩/|/ˈvɪsən/}} ===Verb=== {{de-verb-irregular|weiß|wusste|gewusst}} # {{lb|de|transitive|or|intransitive}} to [[know]]; to be [[aware]] of (a fact) #: ''Ich '''weiß''', wo du bist.'' — “I know where you are.” #: ''von etwas '''wissen''''' — “to know about something” # to [[remember]] #* '''1960''', {{w|Marie Luise Kaschnitz}}, ‘Schneeschmelze’: #*: »Als er neun Jahre alt war«, sagte die Frau, »hat er mich zum ersten Mal geschlagen. '''Weißt''' du noch?« #*:: ''"When he was nine," said the woman, "he hit me for the first time. Do you remember?"'' ====Usage notes==== * See {{m|de|kennen}} for the distinction between this verb and ''wissen.'' ====Conjugation==== {{de-conj-pp|wiss|weiß|wuss|wüss|gewusst|h|a}} ====Related terms==== * {{l|de|weiß der Geier}} * {{l|de|weiß der Kuckuck}} * {{l|de|weiß der Teufel}} * {{l|de|Wissen}} * {{l|de|Wissenschaft}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}}
